1.heading: Sae.
1.title: Sunshine Sketch
1.author: Ume Aoki ; translation, Satsuki Yamashita ; lettering, Keiran O'Leary.
notes: Originally published in Japan in 2005 as Hidamari Sukecchi by Houbunsha Co., Ltd., Tokyo.

Summary (from OCLC): Accepted to a high school specializing in the arts, Yuno moves into a nearby apartment complex to make her commute easier. Just a few days into her new routine, she quickly discovers that creativity doesn't end with the art school bell! Her neighbors
Sae, Hiro, and Miya

are all fellow students, and each has her own hilarious quirks. And eccentricity clearly rules at this school: Yuno's homeroom teacher is a cosplay otaku and the principal, well, he's just weird. Will the quiet Yuno be able to handle this creatively kooky cast of characters?

2.heading: Sae mon nara iut nara. Che 9-kwon, uri nara. English.
2.title: Korea Unmasked : In Search of the Country, the Society and the People
2.author: Won-bok Rhie ; translated by Jung UN & Louis Choi.
notes: Translation of: Sae mon nara iut nara. Che 9-kwon, Uri nara.

4.heading: Saeba, Ryu.
4.title: Cheng shi lie ren [videorecording] = City Hunter
4.author: jian zhi Cai Lan ; dao yan, bian ju Wong Jing.
notes: 1 videodisc : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Joey Wong.
DVD.

Summary (from OCLC): Ryu Saeba, hired to find a runaway daughter, discovers her location on a cruise ship. Instead of focusing on returning the woman he wants to become romantically involved with her. When criminals hijack the ship to hold the passengers for ransom, its up to Ryo to save the day.
Originally released as a motion picture in 1992.
In Cantonese or English with Chinese and English subtitles.
"Based on a popular Japanese comic strip."

Special features: exclusive interviews with cast and crew, new City Hunter outtakes video, Jackie Chan movie photo gallery and biography, movie photo gallery, new and original trailers, original promotional materials.

6.heading: Saeger, Maarten De.
6.title: Diaspora

notes: (De Furox ; 1)
Fantasy genre, set during the rise of the Nazis in the 1930s.

7.heading: Saeki, Nanako.
7.title: The Flowers of Evil
7.author: Shuzo Oshimi.
notes: "Originally published in Japanese as Aku no Hana by Kodansha, Ltd.

Summary (from publisher's website via SkyRiver): "Takao Kasuga is a bookworm. And his favorite book right now is Baudelaire's Flowers of Evil. While the young man may often be seen lost in thought as he rabidly consumes page after page, Takao is not much of a student. Actually when we are first introduced to the middle school teen, we find him sneaking some reading as he receives and F on a recent language exam. Nakagawa is known as the class bully. When she is not receiving zeros she is usually muttering profanities to those around her. While she doesn't care for books or their readers, she does have a thing for troublemakers. Takao may not be one, but having read over his shoulder a few times, she knows he is not very innocent. If anything he is bored and aware of it. Together, by chance, they shake up their entire rural community as Takao tries to break out of his shell in a random moment of passion and affection...not directed towards Nakamura. And contrary to Takao's predictions, the girl he was falling for, Nanako Saeki, responds by eventually accepting the bibliophile for who he is. Or at least, who she thinks he is. And therein lies the conflict. Takao is not a hero. He is not troublemaker, either. He is a regular teen who through equal moments of cowardice and chivalry takes a long step towards adulthood as he desperately tries to cover up a dark secret. Takao Kusuga has stolen an item precious to someone he is attracted to, and if he doesn't form a "contract" with his new best friend, she is going to tell."

9.heading: Saeki, Yoshitaka.
9.title: Vanilla
9.author: Riyu Yamakami ; translation, Sachiko Sato ; lettering, Samantha Yamanaka.
notes: (Juné)
(Yaoi Manga)
Complete in 2 vols.
Translation of: Vanira.
"Parental advisory, explicit content."

"Ah, high school: time of friends, college entrance exams, and children making the transition to adulthood. But lately, seventeen-year-old Ichiru Morio is noticing more than ever that he's different from other boys his age. Whereas his friends are fantisizing about the pleasures of the female flesh, Ichiru finds himself strangely indifferent towards girls. Enter Yoshitaka Saeki, the cold and callous chemistry teacher who, despite his horrible attitude, has unwittingly enthralled Ichiru at first sight. Is handsome Saeki the remedy for Ichiru's apathy? Or is there really something wrong with him after all?"

Nro. 286: Der kleine Pepe mit der neuen Hose. Nro. 291-292: Die wunderbare Bärenjad. Nro. 300-301: Der Bauer und der Windmüller. Nro. 308: Das Raben-Nest. Nro. 316-317: Der Bauer und sein Schwein. Nro. 325: Die beiden Enten und der Frosch. Nro. 327: Der Hahnenkampf. Nro. 330: Der hohle Zahn. Nro. 342: Der Bauer und das Kalb. Nro. 350: Diogenes und die bösen Buben von Korinth. Nro. 354: Die Rache des Elephanten. Nro. 361: Der hinterlistige Heinrich. Nro. 367: Der Affe und der Schusterjunge. Nro. 370: Die Rutschpartie. Nro. 376: Adelens Spaziergang. Nro. 387: Der Schnuller. Nro. 390: Die gestörte und wiedergefundene Nachtruhe, oder der Floh. Nro. 399: Der gewandte, kunstreiche Barbier und sein kluger Hund. Nro. 405-406: Naturgeschichtliches Alphabet. Nro. 412: Das warme Bad. Nro. 425: Die Fliege. Nro. 427-428: Zwei Diebe. Nro. 431: Die Strafe der Faulheit. Nro. 432: Der Lohn des Fleisses. Nro. 436: Der neidische Handwerksbursch. Nro. 439: Die Entführung aus dem Serail. Nro. 443: Die feindlichen Nachbarn. Nro. 453: Der unfreiwillige Spazierritt. Nro. 455: Schmied und Teufel. Nro. 465: Der Virtuos. Nro. 472: Vetter Franz auf dem Esel. Nro. 474: Die Verwandlung. Nro. 477: Die kluge Ratte ; Gestörte Freude. Nro. 485: Müller und Schornsteinfeger. Nro. 510: Der Morgen nach dem Silvesterabend. Nro. 527-528: Die Brille. Nro. 537: Der Deserteur. Nro. 554: Das Napoleonspiel. Nro. 549: Die Folgen der Kraft. Nro. 562: Eugen, der Honigschlecker. Nro. 626: Die Hungerpille.

notes: Summary: The three women decide to leave the service and work by themselves, for causes they choose themselves. They have a briefcase full of diamonds to finance this.
Plates numbered 1-5.

60.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan des Dames) / Renaud ; J.-L.
60.title: Vernal. p. 11-15 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 315
60.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Le Brelan de Dams lêche le 'service secret'! Nos jolies dames ont décidé de se lancer seules dans d'autres opérations. Le chef n'est pas d'accord, mais on ne prend pas si facilement un Brelan de Dames!"
Plates numbered 6-10.
"À suivre."

61.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.-L.
61.title: Vernal. p. 16-20 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 39
61.author: [No author]
notes: 35th anniversary special issue.

"Résumé: Enfin! Elles l'ont trouvée, l'ffaire à dénouer! Et voila nos trois jolies dames qui s'envolent vers de nouvelles aventures. Un voyage mouvementé avant d'atteindre le Nouveau Mexique. Et Jaimie a de bien drôles d'idées!"
Plates numbered 11, 11 bis, 12-14
Plate 11 bis is for the anniversary celebration.
"À suivre."

62.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.-L.
62.title: Vernal. p. 21-25 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 317
62.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: L'enquête démarre et nos trois jolies dames s'attaquent, semble-t-il, à un très gros morçeau: la 'Mac Yavel'! Pour cela, la finesse est de rigeur, et les déguisements permettant d'accéder à des endroits réputés impossibles!"
Plates numbered 15-19.
"À suivre."

63.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.L.
63.title: Vernal. p. 14-17 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 318
63.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Laurence a réussi sa mission! Pendant ce temps, Jaimie s'apprête pour un voyage aérien très spécial et Amanda se met à la recherche de Luis Ortéga. Le travail de sape a commencé!"
Plates numbered 20-23.
"À suivre."

64.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.L.
64.title: Vernal. p. 29-33 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 319
64.author: [No author]
notes: Plates numbered 24-28.
"À suivre."

65.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.-L.
65.title: Vernal. p. 33-37 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 320
65.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Opération terminée! La Mac Yavel saute! Et nos trois jolies dames s'envolent vers la Zébril, à la recherche de Luis Ortega!"
Plates numbered 28-33.
"À suivre."

66.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.L.
66.title: Vernal. p. 34-38 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 321
66.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: L'explosion de la Mac Yavel n'est passé inaperçue et Jamie no plus! À Zébrilia, nos trois jolies dames ont raté de peu Luis Ortéga. La poursuite s'engage et notre joyeux trio tombe dans un piège."
Plates numbered 38-38.
"À suivre."

67.heading: "Safari dans l'Enfer Vert" (Brelan de Dames) / Renaud ; J.-L.
67.title: Vernal. p. 27-34 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 322
67.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Nos trois jolies dames ont tôt fait de se délivrer, mais comment arrêter Luis Ortéga! Pendant ce temps, la chasse commence et les indiens Moustikhos en sont les victimes!"
Plates numbered 39-46.
Final installment.

Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "Join a pair of young newlyweds as they descend deep into a mysterious forest, encountering unknown creatures and un imaginable landscapes. Amongst the unusual flora and fauna, they discover within themselves something more strange and terrible than any sight their safari has to offer. Safari Honeymoon is a tale of jungle love and jungle madness."

138.heading: Safe Haven.
138.title: Deadworld : Slaughterhouse
138.author: Gary Reed, writer ; Sami Makkonen, artist ; Nate Pride, Bernie Lee, letterers.
notes: ca. 112 p. : ill. ; 23 cm.

Summary (from amazon.com via SkyRiver): "Many humans find themselves trapped in a world of the walking dead and the living who will do anything to survive. The promise of "Safe Haven" reveals a much darker and sinister purpose, when victims find themselves in a medical facility, a "Slaughterhouse," which will stop at nothing to combat the zombie plague, including using humans as guinea pigs. Survivors find that the greatest horror may not be the zombies, but their own kind!"
